sen.j: 葛木御歳神社（かつらぎみとしじんじゃ）は、奈良県御所市にある神社である。
sen.e: Katsuragi Mitoshi-jinja Shrine is located in Ose City, Nara Prefecture.
Katsuragi Mitoshi-jinja Shrine is located in Ose City, Nara Prefecture.
Katsuragi Mitoshi-jinja Shrine is located in Ose City, Nara Prefecture.
It is shikinaisha (myojin-taisha).
It is shikinaisha (myojin-taisha).
It is shikinaisha (myojin-taisha).

sen.j: 御歳は「みとせ」とも読まれる。
sen.e: 御歳 is also called 'Mitose'.
御歳 is also called 'Mitose'.
御歳 is also called 'Mitose.'

sen.j: 年神を主祭神とし、大年神と高照姫命を配祀する。
sen.e: The main enshrined god is Toshi no kami, and Otoshi no kami and Takateruhime no mikoto are also enshrined together.
The main enshrined god is Toshi no kami, and Otoshi no kami and Takateruhime no mikoto are also enshrined together.
The main enshrined deity is Toshi no kami, and Otoshi no kami and Takateruhime no mikoto are also enshrined together.

sen.j: 日本全国にある御歳神社・大歳神社の総本社とされる。
sen.e: It is the head shrine of Mitoshi-jinja Shrines and Otoshi-jinja Shrines across Japan.
It is the head shrine of Mitoshi-jinja Shrines and Otoshi-jinja Shrines across Japan.
It is the head shrine of Mitoshi-jinja Shrines and Otoshi-jinja Shrines across Japan.

sen.j: 葛城氏・鴨氏によって祀られた神社である。
sen.e: It was enshrined by the Katsuragi clan and the Kamo clan.
It was enshrined by the Katsuragi clan and the Kamo clan.
It was enshrined by the Katsuragi clan and the Kamo clan.

sen.j: 高鴨神社（高鴨社）・鴨都波神社（下鴨社）に対して「中鴨社」とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: With Takakamo-jinja Shrine (Takakamo-sha) and Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine (Shimokamo-sha), it is called 'Nakakamo-sha'.
With Takakamo-jinja Shrine (Takakamo-sha) and Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine (Shimokamo-sha), it is called 'Nakakamo-sha'.
With Takakamo-jinja Shrine (Takakamo-sha) and Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine (Shimokamo-sha), it is called 'Nakakamo-sha.'

sen.j: 創建の由緒は不詳である。
sen.e: The origin of the shrine is unknown.
The origin of the shrine is unknown.
The origin of the shrine is unknown.

sen.j: 当社の背後に御年山（みとしやま）があり、これを神体山として田の神を祀ったものとみられる。
sen.e: It is said that Mt. Mitoshi lying behind the shrine was considered as a sacred mountain and a god of rice fields was enshrined there.
It is said that Mt. Mitoshi lying behind the shrine was considered a sacred mountain and a god of rice fields was enshrined there.
It is said that Mt. Mitoshi lying behind the shrine was considered a sacred mountain and a god of rice fields was enshrined there.

sen.j: 最も古い記録は『新抄格勅符抄』の天平神護元年（765年）「御年神十三戸、大和三戸、讃岐十戸」とあるものである。
sen.e: Its oldest record is seen in the chapter of 765 of 'Shnshokyakuchokufusho' (the record of legal history), which described 'Otoshi-gami thirteen houses, Yamato three houses, Sanuki ten houses'.
Its oldest record is seen in chapter 765 of 'Shinshokyakuchokufusho' (the record of legal history), which described 'Otoshi-gami thirteen houses, Yamato three houses, Sanuki ten houses'.
Its oldest record is seen in chapter 765 of 'Shinshokyakuchokufusho' (the record of legal history), which described 'Otoshi-gami thirteen houses, Yamato three houses, Sanuki ten houses.'

sen.j: 仁寿2年（852年）には、当時大和国で最高位となる正二位の神階を贈られ、延喜式神名帳では名神大社に列している。
sen.e: In 852, it received the highest ranking of the god, Shonii and ranked among Myojin-taisha Shrines in Engishikijinmeicho (a list of the shrines compiled in 927).
In 852, it received the highest ranking of the god, Shonii and ranked among Myojin-taisha Shrines in Engishikijinmeicho (a list of the shrines compiled in 927).
In 852, it received the highest ranking of the god, Shonii and ranked among Myojin-taisha Shrines in Engishiki Jinmyocho (a list of the shrines compiled in 927).

sen.j: 平安時代以降、一帯は春日大社・興福寺の荘園となっており、当社は春日大社の影響下にあった。
sen.e: Since the Heian period, the whole area of the shrine was shoen (manor) of Kasuga-taisha Shrine and Kofuku-ji Temple and it was under the influence of Kasuga-taisha Shrine.
After the Heian period, the whole area of the shrine was shoen (manor) of Kasuga-taisha Shrine and Kofuku-ji Temple and it was under the influence of Kasuga-taisha Shrine.
After the Heian period, the whole area of the shrine was shoen (manor) of Kasuga-taisha Shrine and Kofuku-ji Temple and it was under the influence of Kasuga-taisha Shrine.

sen.j: 現在の本殿は、江戸時代に春日大社の本殿第一殿を移築したものである。
sen.e: The current main shrine is the first main shrine of Kasuga-taisha Shrine which was brought over from Kasugat-taisha Shrine and reassembled there during the Edo period.
The current main shrine is the first main shrine of Kasuga-taisha Shrine which was brought over from Kasugat-taisha Shrine and reassembled there during the Edo period.
The current main shrine is the first main shrine of Kasuga-taisha Shrine which was brought over from Kasugat-taisha Shrine and reassembled there during the Edo period.

sen.j: 日本三代実録によれば、貞観 (日本)8年（866年）、朝廷が任命した神官を当社が拒否したという。
sen.e: According to Nihon sandai jitsuroku (historical material), the shrine rejected to accept a Shinto priest who was appointed by the Imperial Court in 866.
According to Nihon sandai jitsuroku (historical material), the shrine rejected to accept a Shinto priest who was appointed by the Imperial Court in 866.
According to Nihon sandai jitsuroku (historical material), the shrine rejected to accept a Shinto priest who was appointed by the Imperial Court in 866.

sen.j: それ以降、大正時代まで神職は置かれていなかった。
sen.e: Since then, Shinto priesthood had not been appointed till the Taisho period.
After that, a Shinto priest was not appointed until the Taisho period.
After that, a Shinto priest was not appointed until the Taisho period.
